Class DynamicTreeBroadPhase

Namespace
Alis.Core.Physic.Collision.BroadPhase
Assembly
Alis.dll

The broad-phase is used for computing pairs and performing volume queries and ray casts. This broad-phase does not persist pairs. Instead, this reports potentially new pairs. It is up to the client to consume the new pairs and to track subsequent overlap.

public class DynamicTreeBroadPhase : IBroadPhase

Query(Func<int, bool>, ref Aabb)

Query an AABB for overlapping proxies. The callback class is called for each proxy that overlaps the supplied AABB.

This is called from DynamicTree.Query when we are gathering pairs.

internal bool QueryCallback(int proxyId)

Returns

bool

RayCast(Func<RayCastInput, int, float>, ref RayCastInput)

Ray-cast against the proxies in the tree. This relies on the callback to perform a exact ray-cast in the case were the proxy contains a shape. The callback also performs the any collision filtering. This has performance roughly equal to k * log(n), where k is the number of collisions and n is the number of proxies in the tree.

public void RayCast(Func<RayCastInput, int, float> callback, ref RayCastInput input)

Parameters

callback Func<RayCastInput, int, float>

A callback class that is called for each proxy that is hit by the ray.

input RayCastInput

The ray-cast input data. The ray extends from p1 to p1 + maxFraction * (p2 - p1).

RemoveProxy(int)

Destroy a proxy. It is up to the client to remove any pairs.

public void RemoveProxy(int proxyId)
